questions.text: Which nerve supplies the hybrid muscle partially spared in a patient who presented with sciatica and tender hamstrings? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

  • ➤ hybrid muscles

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presented with fever, confusion, and altered mental status. On examination, he has jaundice, reduced urine output, low BP, and a feeble pulse. Lab studies reveal severe anemia, thrombocytopenia, and elevated liver enzymes. Peripheral smear revealed P. falciparum. What is the best treatment? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) IV artesunate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of severe falciparum malaria, the first-line treatment is IV artesunate, followed by artemisinin combination therapy (ACT) once the patient stabilizes.

questions.text: A young patient presents to the clinic with erythematous lesions over the exposed areas of the skin like hands, arms, chest, etc. She also complains of arthralgia and breathlessness. Which among the following antibodies will be useful in diagnosing this condition? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Anti-dsDNA antibodies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-dsDNA antibodies are highly specific for diagnosing Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), despite their moderate sensitivity.

questions.text: All the following are indications of caesarean section except? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Previous history of macrosomia

  • • D

  • • Absolute indications
  • • Central placenta praevia Contracted pelvis or CPD Pelvic mass causing obstruction Advanced CA cervix Vaginal obstruction (atresia, stenosis)
  • • Central placenta praevia
  • • Contracted pelvis or CPD
  • • Pelvic mass causing obstruction
  • • Advanced CA cervix
  • • Vaginal obstruction (atresia, stenosis)

Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding management of diabetes in pregnancy? (INICET MAY 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Elective C-section has no role in reducing incidence of brachial plexus injury

options.label: B
options.text: In a patient being planned for induction of labor, night dose of intermediate insulin is given as planned, and the morning dose is withheld

options.label: C
options.text: In active labor, if RBS <70 mg%, D5 is started at 100-150 ml/h till the RBS is >100 mg%

options.label: D
options.text: Capillary blood glucose monitoring levels are kept at fasting- 95 mg%; 1 h postprandial- 140 mg%; 2 h postprandial: 120 mg%

questions.correct_answer: A. Elective C-section has no role in reducing incidence of brachial plexus injury
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Elective C-section has no role in reducing incidence of brachial plexus injury

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • False statement regarding management of diabetes in pregnancy is option A. The Cesarean section is found to be protective against traumatic injuries such as brachial plexus injury, in macrosomic babies born to mothers with diabetes. Elective LSCS is recommended when the estimated fetal weight is > 4.5kg in diabetic mothers to reduce the incidence of birth trauma
  • • False statement regarding management of diabetes in pregnancy is option A.
  • • The Cesarean section is found to be protective against traumatic injuries such as brachial plexus injury, in macrosomic babies born to mothers with diabetes.
  • • Elective LSCS is recommended when the estimated fetal weight is > 4.5kg in diabetic mothers to reduce the incidence of birth trauma
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. In a patient being planned for induction of labor, night dose of intermediate insulin is given as planned, and the morning dose is withheld : In a planned delivery, although the bedtime dose of intermediate-acting insulin is given, it is recommended that the morning dose must be withheld
  • • Option B. In a patient being planned for induction of labor, night dose of intermediate insulin is given as planned, and the morning dose is withheld
  • • Insulin Management for Labor Induction or Scheduled Cesarean Delivery
  • • Insulin Management for Labor Induction or Scheduled Cesarean Delivery
  • • Option C. In active labor, if RBS <70 mg%, D5 is started at 100-150 ml/h till the RBS is >100 mg%: In active labor, if RBS (Random blood glucose) <70 mg%, D5 (5% dextrose) is started at 100-150 ml/h till the RBS is >100 mg%. Before initiation of labor, normal saline is used for iv infusion.
  • • Option C. In active labor, if RBS <70 mg%, D5 is started at 100-150 ml/h till the RBS is >100 mg%:
  • • Option D. Capillary blood glucose monitoring levels are kept at fasting- 95 mg%; 1 h postprandial- 140 mg%; 2 h postprandial: 120 mg%: Self-monitoring of capillary blood glucose is advised in a pregnant woman diagnosed with diabetes. The glucose goals recommended are:
  • • Option D. Capillary blood glucose monitoring levels are kept at fasting- 95 mg%; 1 h postprandial- 140 mg%; 2 h postprandial: 120 mg%:
  • • Fasting: 95 mg/dL 1 h postprandial: 140 mg/dL 2 h postprandial: 120 mg/dL
  • • Fasting: 95 mg/dL
  • • 1 h postprandial: 140 mg/dL
  • • 2 h postprandial: 120 mg/dL

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Elective C-section can reduce the incidence of brachial plexus injury in pregnancies complicated by diabetes, especially in cases of fetal macrosomia.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 2807, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 2807, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 2807, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition

questions.text: A woman who got IUCD inserted at a PHC, now presents with bleeding. What should be done by the MO? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Iron supplement and observation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron supplementation and observation are crucial in managing post-IUCD insertion bleeding to prevent anemia. If bleeding persists, further action, such as removing the IUCD, may be necessary.
  • ➤ Iron supplementation and observation

questions.text: Many GPCR receptors act via increase in cAMP. There are several steps involved in this mechanism as given below. Which of the following is correct sequence of events in cAMP signal transduction pathway? ( INICET May 2024) Steps involved 1. Activation of adenylate cyclase 2. Activation of PKA 3. Conversion of ATP to cAMP 4. Phosphorylation of target proteins
questions.explanation: Ans. B) 1, 3, 2 and 4

questions.text: A patient reports a painless mass that has been gradually increasing in size. An X-ray has been performed. What is the diagnosis?(FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Osteochondroma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Osteochondroma is a benign condition that typically presents as a painless, slowly growing mass near the growth plates of long bones. It's identified on X-rays by its distinct protrusion with a cartilaginous cap.
  • ➤ Osteochondroma is a benign condition that typically presents as a painless, slowly growing mass near the growth plates of long bones. It's identified on X-rays by its distinct protrusion with a cartilaginous cap.

questions.text: The parents notice that their child is tired and that he has shortness of breath on climbing stairs and while lying down. What is the first investigation that you would do? ( INICET Nov 2022)

options.label: D
options.text: MRI to rule out enlarged heart

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Chest x-ray

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a child presenting with shortness of breath on exertion and orthopnea, the first investigation should be a chest x-ray to evaluate potential pulmonary pathology and signs of congestive heart failure.

questions.text: A 50-year-old male patient presents with headache and seizures. On examination his BP is 220/110 mm Hg. What is the most appropriate treatment? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) IV Labetalol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In neurological hypertensive emergencies, the first-line treatment options for reducing blood pressure are IV nicardipine or IV labetalol, with IV labetalol being preferred if IV nicardipine is unavailable.

questions.text: A patient with schizophrenia, who did not respond to haloperidol and thioridazine, was started on drug A. After beginning treatment with drug A, the patient's psychotic symptoms improved; however, he developed sialorrhea, dyslipidemia, weight gain, and hyperglycemia. Which drug is most likely to be 'drug A'? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Clozapine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the treatment of treatment-resistant schizophrenia, Clozapine is often effective where other antipsychotics have failed. However, its use is associated with notable side effects including sialorrhea, significant weight gain, dyslipidemia, and hyperglycemia.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: The Maudsley Prescribing Guidelines in Psychiatry, 14th edition, Page No 222-224.

questions.text: What is the cause of the lesion shown in the image below?(INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Lightning strike

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Filigree burns or Lichtenberg flowers are pathognomonic for lightning strikes and appear as superficial, fern-like patterns on the skin that fade within 24-48 hours.

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman presents with complaints of progressive loss of vision in the right halves of both eyes. Where is the lesion located in the optic pathway? ( NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Left optic tract

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Right homonymous hemianopia, characterized by loss of the right visual field in both eyes, is caused by a lesion in the left optic tract.

questions.text: A 4-year-old child with muscle wasting and skinny appearance. Which of the following condition best fit the diagnosis? ( FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Marasmus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Marasmus is characterized by severe wasting of muscle and subcutaneous fat, leading to a very thin, emaciated appearance in affected children.

questions.text: A known patient of tuberculosis, on INH for the past 3 months complains of numbness, tingling and burning sensation in all the extremities. What could be vitamin deficiency?(NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Vitamin B6

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Isoniazid inhibits pyridoxal phosphokinase which is required for synthesis of biologically active form of pyridoxine (B6) i.e. pyridoxal phosphate. Thus, isoniazid inhibits the formation of the active form of B 6 . As Vit. B6 (PLP) is required for niacin (B 3 ) synthesis from tryptophan, hence isoniazid therapy also causes Niacin deficiency. In this question, best answer to mark is B 6 as INH directly inhibits B 6 formation.
  • ➤ Isoniazid inhibits pyridoxal phosphokinase which is required for synthesis of biologically active form of pyridoxine (B6) i.e. pyridoxal phosphate. Thus, isoniazid inhibits the formation of the active form of B 6 .
  • ➤ B 6
  • ➤ As Vit. B6 (PLP) is required for niacin (B 3 ) synthesis from tryptophan, hence isoniazid therapy also causes Niacin deficiency.
  • ➤ In this question, best answer to mark is B 6 as INH directly inhibits B 6 formation.

References:

  • ↳ Reference : Dinesh Puri 3 rd ed/pg-371

questions.text: A patient from Uttar Pradesh presented with fever, pallor, and hepatosplenomegaly. Peripheral smear examination showed pancytopenia. Buffy coat examination showed macrophages laden with organisms with a kinetoplast. What is the vector for the likely disease? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sandfly

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Visceral leishmaniasis, caused by Leishmania donovani and transmitted by sandflies, is a severe systemic disease. Recognizing its epidemiology, clinical presentation, and diagnostic features is crucial for prompt diagnosis and treatment. Awareness and control of the vector, along with appropriate medical intervention, are essential in areas endemic for this disease.

questions.text: Tracheal innermost layer has which epithelial lining? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pseudostratified columnar epithelium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The innermost layer of the trachea is lined with pseudostratified columnar epithelium, which appears layered due to the positioning of cell nuclei but is actually a single layer of cells designed to protect the respiratory tract and facilitate mucus movement.

questions.text: A civil engineer in Kerala is designing a wastewater treatment facility for a growing town. He considers implementing an oxidation pond, a natural wastewater treatment system. Which of the following best describes the microbial activity of the oxidation pond? (FMGE JAN 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Aerobic during day time and anaerobic during night time

options.label: B
options.text: Anaerobic during day time and aerobic during night time

options.label: C
options.text: Anaerobic during day time and night time

options.label: D
options.text: Aerobic during day time and night time

questions.correct_answer: A. Aerobic during day time and anaerobic during night time
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Aerobic during day time and anaerobic during night time.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oxidation ponds utilize aerobic microbial activity during the day and anaerobic activity at night to treat wastewater effectively.

questions.text: A 20-year old male patient is presenting with hematuria and hemoptysis. On further testing Anti glomerular basement membrane antibody is positive, what will be the diagnosis? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)  Goodpasture syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Goodpasture syndrome is characterized by the presence of anti-glomerular basement membrane antibodies, hematuria, and hemoptysis, and is a type II hypersensitivity reaction associated with type I Rapidly Progressive Glomerulonephritis (RPGN).

questions.text: Mental Health Gap Action (mhGAP) Program does not include: ( INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) OCD

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ OCD (Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder) is not included in the WHO's Mental Health Gap Action (mhGAP) program, which focuses on other high-burden mental health conditions.

questions.text: A patient presents with cervical lymphadenopathy and is found to be retropositive. A fungal culture depicts a velvety growth with red diffusible pigment on the underside, as shown below. Which is the most likely causative organism? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Talaromyces marneffei

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Recognition of the red diffusible pigment in culture is critical in identifying Talaromyces marneffei infection, particularly in HIV-positive patients. It's important to consider this pathogen when patients from endemic regions present with systemic symptoms and lymphadenopathy. Treatment involves antifungal therapy tailored to the severity of the infection, with agents such as itraconazole for mild cases and amphotericin B for severe cases.

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient presents with chest pain and an ECG was taken. What will be the likely diagnosis? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anterior MI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anterior MI is characterized by ST elevations in leads V1 to V4, with possible involvement of V5 and AVL, and reciprocal ST depressions in leads II, III, and aVF.

questions.text: Which of the following disease has the highest mortality once clinically manifested? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Rabies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rabies has the highest mortality rate once clinical symptoms appear, making it virtually 100% fatal without immediate post-exposure prophylaxis.

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statement in rapid sequence intubation? (INICET NOVEMBER 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Preoxygenation with 100% oxygen for 3 minutes is done.

options.label: B
options.text: High-volume low-pressure cuff Endotracheal tube is used.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients .

options.label: D
options.text: Induction agent and muscle relaxant are given simultaneously.

questions.correct_answer: C. It is the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients .
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. It is the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective :
  • ➤ Rapid sequence intubation is not the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients due to the need for immediate airway management and ongoing chest compressions, making drug administration less critical.

questions.text: Glucose load for screening diabetes in pregnancy is: (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 75 gm

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • According to the majority of guidelines, including the WHO, IADPSG (International Association of Diabetes and Pregnancy Study Groups), and DIPSI (Diabetes in Pregnancy Study Group India) guidelines, a 75 gm glucose load is used for screening diabetes in pregnancy.
  • • Note - The ACOG (American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists) guidelines follow a two-step process where the first step involves a 50 gm glucose load for screening, and if positive, a 100 gm glucose load for confirmation.
  • • Note -
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. 25 gm: Not used in any standard screening protocol.
  • • Option A. 25 gm:
  • • Option B. 50 gm: Used in the initial step of the ACOG two-step screening process, but not the most common single-step screening load.
  • • Option B. 50 gm:
  • • Option D. 100 gm: Used in the second step of the ACOG two-step screening process, not for initial screening.
  • • Option D. 100 gm:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For screening diabetes in pregnancy, the 75 gm glucose load is widely used according to various international guidelines, including WHO and IADPSG.

questions.text: Which of the following is seen in UMN (Upper Motor Neuron) weakness? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The hallmark feature of Upper Motor Neuron (UMN) weakness is hyper-reflexia, characterized by exaggerated deep tendon reflexes. This occurs due to the loss of inhibitory control from the brain on the reflex arcs in the spinal cord.

questions.text: Which of the following is a bioterrorism category A agent? ( NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Anthrax

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Bacillus anthracis which causes anthrax is categorized under category A bioterrorism agent.
  • ➤ Other category A agents are:
  • ➤ Botulism (Clostridium botulinum toxin) Plague (Yersinia pestis) Smallpox (Variola virus) Tularemia (Francisella tularensis) - Francisella tularensis bacteria cause tularemia, also known as rabbit fever.
  • ➤ Botulism (Clostridium botulinum toxin)
  • ➤ Plague (Yersinia pestis)
  • ➤ Smallpox (Variola virus)
  • ➤ Tularemia (Francisella tularensis) - Francisella tularensis bacteria cause tularemia, also known as rabbit fever.

questions.text: A chronic tobacco chewer presents with left cheek swelling. On examination a white membrane is seen over the gingiva buccal fold, which doesn’t get rubbed off. What will be your next line of management? (FMGE JANUARY 2023)

options.label: B
options.text: Stop tobacco and don’t worry about the patch

options.label: C
options.text: Chemical cauterization with trichloroacetic acetic acid

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Surgical excision and biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leukoplakia can potentially transform into a malignancy, and thus, any suspicious lesion in the oral cavity should be excised and biopsied for a definitive diagnosis and to rule out cancer.

questions.text: A child presented in the pediatric OPD with fever for past 5 days along with cough, coryza, conjunctivitis. The mother also complained of a non itchy rash that appeared just a day back starting from behind the ears involving the face and spreading to the trunk also involving palms and soles. What is the most likely diagnosis? (FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Measles

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Measles is characterized by the "3 C's" (cough, coryza, conjunctivitis) and a non-itchy rash that spreads from behind the ears to the rest of the body, including the palms and soles.

questions.text: Which of the following organisms produce urease? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Helicobacter pylori

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Urease-producing organisms : (Mnemonic-PUNCH)
  • ➤ Urease-producing organisms
  • ➤ Proteus asma urealyticum Nocardia Cryptococcus, Corynebacterium urealyticum H. pylori
  • ➤ Proteus
  • ➤ asma urealyticum
  • ➤ Nocardia
  • ➤ Cryptococcus, Corynebacterium urealyticum
  • ➤ H. pylori

questions.text: Match the following stains with their respective tissue: (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1-a, 2-b, 3-d, 4-c

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Prussian blue (a) : This stain is used to detect iron in tissue samples, specifically hemosiderin, a storage form of iron. PAS (b) : The Periodic Acid-Schiff (PAS) stain is used to highlight glycogen and other carbohydrates in tissues. It is commonly used in diagnosing certain storage diseases and fungal infections. Congo red (c) : Congo red is a special stain used to detect amyloid , a protein that can abnormally accumulate in tissues, leading to conditions such as amyloidosis. Under polarized light, amyloid stained with Congo red shows apple-green birefringence. Fite Faraco stain (d) : This stain is used to detect leprosy bacilli (Mycobacterium leprae) in tissue samples. It is a modification of the acid-fast stain and is specifically tailored to highlight these bacteria.
  • • Prussian blue (a) : This stain is used to detect iron in tissue samples, specifically hemosiderin, a storage form of iron.
  • • Prussian blue (a)
  • • iron
  • • PAS (b) : The Periodic Acid-Schiff (PAS) stain is used to highlight glycogen and other carbohydrates in tissues. It is commonly used in diagnosing certain storage diseases and fungal infections.
  • • PAS (b)
  • • Periodic Acid-Schiff (PAS)
  • • glycogen
  • • Congo red (c) : Congo red is a special stain used to detect amyloid , a protein that can abnormally accumulate in tissues, leading to conditions such as amyloidosis. Under polarized light, amyloid stained with Congo red shows apple-green birefringence.
  • • Congo red (c)
  • • amyloid
  • • Fite Faraco stain (d) : This stain is used to detect leprosy bacilli (Mycobacterium leprae) in tissue samples. It is a modification of the acid-fast stain and is specifically tailored to highlight these bacteria.
  • • Fite Faraco stain (d)
  • • leprosy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Donor blood should be screened for the following infections except: (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Dengue virus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Donor blood require screening for infectious disease pathogen:
  • ➤ Hepatitis C virus Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) Hepatitis B virus Malaria Syphilis.
  • ➤ Hepatitis C virus
  • ➤ Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)

questions.text: A patient with suicidal tendency ingested some substance. He presents with tachycardia, dilated pupil, and hypertension. Identify the drug. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cocaine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cocaine toxicity is characterized by sympathetic overdrive symptoms such as tachycardia, dilated pupils, and hypertension, making it the likely substance in cases of suspected sympathomimetic drug overdose.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is the causative agent associated with in this case? (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Pure red cell aplasia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Parvovirus B19, the causative agent of erythema infectiosum, is associated with pure red cell aplasia, particularly in individuals with underlying hemolytic disorders.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a perineal approach for rectal prolapse? ( INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ripstein’s procedure

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Ripstein's procedure is done for its management using the abdominal approach. The perineal approach is often preferred in elderly patients with high operative risk and limited life expectancy. It involves surgeries such as Delorme's mucosectomy and Thiersch's wiring, which have higher recurrence rates than the abdominal approach.
  • ➤ abdominal

questions.text: A woman presented with morning stiffness that gradually resolves over one hour. Which of the following statements is correct regarding this condition? (INICET NOV 2020) NSAIDs can improve the symptoms and have disease modifying activity. Absence of erosion rules out the diagnosis. It is associated with raised ESR and CRP. HLA DR4 is related to the prognosis
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rheumatoid arthritis presents with raised serum ESR and quantitative CRP levels, and HLA DR4 positivity.
  • ➤ Rheumatoid arthritis presents with raised serum ESR and quantitative CRP levels, and HLA DR4 positivity.

questions.text: Identify the Sensory nerve supply for the given area of hand? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Radial nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sensory function of the radial nerve is provided by its four main sensory branches:
  • ➤ The sensory function of the radial nerve is provided by its four main sensory branches:
  • ➤ Inferior lateral cutaneous nerve of the arm: Supplies the lateral aspect of the anterior upper arm between the deltoid and the elbow. Posterior cutaneous nerve of the arm: Supplies part of the posterior aspect of the upper arm. Posterior cutaneous nerve of the forearm: Supplies a tapered strip of the middle portion of the posterior forearm. Superficial branch of the radial nerve: Supplies the posterior surface of the lateral 3 ½ digits and the associated areas of the palm.
  • ➤ Inferior lateral cutaneous nerve of the arm: Supplies the lateral aspect of the anterior upper arm between the deltoid and the elbow.
  • ➤ Posterior cutaneous nerve of the arm: Supplies part of the posterior aspect of the upper arm.
  • ➤ Posterior cutaneous nerve of the forearm: Supplies a tapered strip of the middle portion of the posterior forearm.
  • ➤ Superficial branch of the radial nerve: Supplies the posterior surface of the lateral 3 ½ digits and the associated areas of the palm.

questions.text: The vasodilator Nitric oxide is synthesized by which amino acid? (FMGE JANUARY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) L -Arginine

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Nitric oxide is synthesized from the amino acid L-arginine. This reaction is catalyzed by the enzyme nitric oxide synthase (NOS). L-arginine is converted to L-citrulline with the release of NO. This process is crucial for the regulation of vascular tone, as NO is a potent vasodilator.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. L-Citrulline: While L-citrulline is involved in the nitric oxide cycle, it is not the precursor for NO synthesis. Instead, it is a byproduct of NO synthesis from L-arginine. L-citrulline can be recycled back to L-arginine, which can then be used again for NO synthesis.
  • • Option B. L-Citrulline:
  • • Option C. Glycine: Glycine is a simple amino acid involved in various metabolic pathways, but it is not the precursor for nitric oxide synthesis. Glycine plays roles in the synthesis of proteins, purines, and other molecules, but not directly in the production of NO.
  • • Option C. Glycine:
  • • Option D. Lysine: Lysine, an essential amino acid, is not involved in the synthesis of nitric oxide. It plays roles in protein synthesis and other metabolic processes, but NO synthesis specifically requires L-arginine.
  • • Option D. Lysine:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ NO is also called as Endothelium Derived Relaxing Factor (EDRF). NO (nitric oxide) is synthesized from arginine by enzyme NOS (Nitric oxide synthase) in the endothelial cells.
  • ➤ NO (nitric oxide) is
  • ➤ synthesized from arginine by enzyme NOS

questions.text: Identify the structure marked in the following MRI scan:(NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Cerebellum

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The given image shows an MRI of the sagittal section of the brain , where the red arrow points to the Cerebellum. This part of the brain is known for its role in motor control, and it can also be involved in some cognitive functions like attention and language.
  • • MRI of the sagittal section of the brain
  • • Key features visible in the MRI that help identify the Cerebellum include its characteristic lobulated structure located at the posterior base of the brain, just below the cerebrum and behind the brainstem and fourth ventricle.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Midbrain: Part of the brainstem, located higher and anteriorly relative to the cerebellum on sagittal images.
  • • Option A. Midbrain:
  • • Option C. Brainstem: The brainstem, which includes the midbrain, pons, and medulla, is located anteriorly to the cerebellum in the image.
  • • Option C. Brainstem:
  • • Option D. Cerebrum: The largest part of the brain, covering most of the upper sections of the image, involved in various higher-order functions.
  • • Option D. Cerebrum:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Cerebellum, distinct in its appearance and location in the posterior aspect of the brain, plays crucial roles in the coordination of voluntary movements and motor functions, which can be clearly seen on sagittal MRI scans.

questions.text: A patient presents with gastrointestinal problems including abdominal pain and distension, bloody and mucus-filled diarrhea, and tenesmus, with rectal prolapse. A stool examination reveals the presence of typical barrel-shaped eggs. What is the possible causative agent? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Trichuris trichiura

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Table listing appearance of various organism in stool/sputum examination
  • ➤ Table listing appearance of various organism in stool/sputum examination
